column2: Description
An operating system from Microsoft. Suited for using windows-specific software like MS Office with its stuff, Adobe apps, most of the games, etc.

column1: Debian Stable, Old Stable and Old Old Stable
column2: A linux distro known for its stability and long-term support. Perfect almost for anybody except those who wants to be at bleeding edge. Very wide in terms of nerding.
A branch of Debian, linux distro known for its stability. Despite the name, offers packages stable for daily use. Perfect for home PCs.

A branch of Debian, linux distro known for its stability. Packages are tested individually, but without checking the distribution as a whole. Used by those who needs latest versions of development libraries.
Based on Debian Stable, suited for low-end PCs. Offers great out-of-the-box experience and sysvinit as an alternative to SystemD.
Fork of Debian, offers sysvinit and OpenRC as an alternatives to SystemD. Uses the same versioning as Debian.
Linux distro from RedHat targeted for servers. Offers latest server software.
Linux distros from RedHat targeted for embedded systems.
Linux distro from RedHat. Offers cool integration with RedHat software.
Based on Debian, very secure, doesn't leave any digital footprint.
Based on Debian. Widely used for pentesting.
A distro known for its excellent wiki and latest packages in repos
To me, it's like Arch before adoption of SystemD. Unfortunately, lacks some packages.
A source-based distro with excellent documentation in form of handbook and great package manager.  Provides latest packages in repos.
Magical source-based distro. Based on dead Sorcerer Linux.
Another magical fork of Sorcerer
Source-based distro, optimized for x86_64. Adopts stuff from BSD
A unique source-based distro featuring its own filesystem hierarchy and boot systems
A source-based distro without package manager
A legend.
Who don't like puppies? UwU Especially when they can run on a slow PC
It's really small
Really tiny
Blazing fast distro
Most popular BSD
BSD that offers great portability
BSD that aims for great security
A fork of FreeBSD featuring some different design concepts
BSD for desktops
